question: Is a product that makes a “Vegan” claim permitted to carry a “may contain milk” precautionary statement?
answer: Yes, a product that makes a vegan claim can also carry a precautionary statement for "may contain milk". However, precautionary statements must not be a substitute for GMP and must not be used when milk is deliberately added to the food.
title: https://inspection.canada.ca/food-labels/labelling/industry/allergens-and-gluten/eng/1707828912921/1707828913592?chap=4
